thread.title: Crime writer claims to have proof of Jack the Ripper's true identity
thread.title_full: Crime writer claims to have proof of Jack the Ripper's true identity

title: Crime writer claims to have proof of Jack the Ripper's true identity
text:
Crime writer claims to have proof of Jack the Ripper's true identity By Adam Duggan 
Best-selling US crime writer Patricia Cornwell claims she has evidence which reveals the identity of notorious London serial killer Jack the Ripper. 
The mortuary assistant turned author, who has sold more than 100 million books since 1990, has long-claimed the Whitechapel serial killer was influential avant-garde artist Walter Sickert. 
Art historians and Ripperolagists, as they are known, labelled Ms Cornwell's original assertions in Portrait of a Killer: Jack the Ripper - Case Closed "improbable". 
But in a book to be released next week, the crime author claims Sickert's guilt lies in letters Ripper sent police at the time. Popular US crime writer Patricia Cornwell has spent millions of dollars researching Jack the Ripper (Image: AP Photo/Jim Cooper) 
Three of Sickert's letters sent to friends and two of the antagonistic notes Ripper sent to police were found to have come from a paper run of just 24 sheets, according to scientific analysis conducted by Ms Cornwell. 
The book also claims to debunk Sickert's alibis and contains claims he would dress up as Jack the Ripper while painting, Daily Mail report. 
Ms Cornwell also claims Sickert confessed to a friend that "he would not mind having to kill and eat raw flesh." Ms Cornwell has long asserted that Walter Sickert is Jack the Ripper (Image: Wikimedia Commons) 
Sickert is renowned within the British art community for his depictions of sex and sleaze in London at the time. 
The author has spent millions of dollars investigating the true identity of Jack the Ripper - including more than $3.2 million for 32 of his paintings, some of his letters and his writing desk. 
Ripper: The Secret Life of Walter Sickert will be released in Australia on February 28. © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017 TRENDING VIDEO Emotional football ad celebrates love A US commercial for the NFL Pro Bowl is being praised for its heart-warming message that “Love Has No Labels”.
